00041 /**
00042  * @brief This function will create log file for test 
00043  * purposes.  
00044  * The path and name of the log file needs to be specified
00045  * prior to use (see fname).
00046  */
00047 
00048 /// a static pointer to the fstream which will be used for "emergency debugging output".
00049 std::fstream* em_out_fstream;
00050 
00051 void em_out(const std::string& msg)
00052 {
00053   // if the stream isnt setup, then open it.
00054         if (em_out_fstream==NULL) {
00055                 em_out_fstream=new std::fstream();
00056                 std::string fname="EM-OUT-"+ToStr((int)getpid())+"-"+ToStr((int)rand())+".log";
00057 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00058                 std::wstring wfname=StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(fname);
00059                 em_out_fstream->open(wfname.c_str(),ios::out);
00060 #else
00061     em_out_fstream->open(fname.c_str(),ios::out);
00062 #endif
00063         }
00064   
00065   // now send the message...
00066         *em_out_fstream << msg << "\n";
00067   // ...and be sure the output goes to the file right away, as
00068   // this function is used when we have a hard to debug crash.
00069         em_out_fstream->flush();
00070 }

00073 /**
00074  * @brief Print a dot out to let the user know we are still alive
00075  * and making progress.
00076  * @param verbosity - What level of verbosity this message should be printed at.
00077  */
00078 void Verbose::progressStep(int verbosity) {
00079   Param &p = getParam();
00080  
00081   assert(p.m_DotCount.size() > 0);
00082   assert(p.m_DotMod.size() > 0);
00083 
00084   if(verbosity <= p.m_Verbosity) {
00085     p.m_DotCount.back()--;
00086     /* Check to see if it is time to call the step report function yet. */
00087     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < p.m_ProHandler.size(); i++) {
00088       if(p.m_DotCount.back() <= 0 || p.m_ProHandler[i]->handleAll()) {
00089         p.m_ProHandler[i]->progressStep(verbosity);
00090       }
00091     }
00092     if(p.m_DotCount.back() <= 0) {
00093       p.m_DotCount.back() = p.m_DotMod.back(); // reset the counter
00094     }
00095   }
00096 }
00097 
00098 /** 
00099  * @brief This function gets around the problem of static variable
00100  * initialization as local static variables work more consistently.
00101  * @return Param - Our static parameters for this class.
00102  */
00103 Verbose::Param &Verbose::getParam() {
00104 
00105   // Avoid weird windows .NET/Forms bug where linking to cout/cerr can cause problems...
00106   static std::ostream *out = NULL;
00107   if (std::cerr.good()) {
00108     out = &std::cerr;
00109   }
00110 #ifdef _NO_STD_OUT
00111   static ProgressDot progHandler(0, NULL);
00112   static MsgStream  msgHandler(0, NULL);
00113 #else
00114   // Normal console mode is ok.
00115   static ProgressDot progHandler(1, out);
00116   static MsgStream msgHandler(1, out);
00117 #endif
00118   // By default we just use a normal message handler as the warning handler.
00119   static Verbose::Param m_Param(&progHandler, &msgHandler, &msgHandler);
00120   return m_Param;
00121 }

00123 /// @brief Functions to add and remove handlers for communcation functions.
00124 void Verbose::pushProgressHandler(ProgressHandler *handler) {
00125   getParam().m_ProHandler.push_back(handler);
00126 }
00127 
00128 void Verbose::popProgressHandler() {
00129   getParam().m_ProHandler.pop_back();

00133   getParam().m_MsgHandler.push_back(handler);
00134   //  pushWarnHandler(handler); // @todo - Make this simpler. Too many push/pop calls currently
00135 }

00138   getParam().m_MsgHandler.pop_back();
00139   //  popWarnHandler(); // @todo - Make this simpler. Too many push/pop calls currently
00140 }

00143   getParam().m_WarnHandler.push_back(handler);

00147   getParam().m_WarnHandler.pop_back();
00148 }

00150 void Verbose::progressBegin(int verbosity, const std::string &msg, int total, int dotMod, int maxCalls) {
00151   std::vector<ProgressHandler *> &m_Handle = getParam().m_ProHandler;
00152   getParam().m_DotMod.push_back(dotMod);
00153   getParam().m_DotCount.push_back(0);
00154   // if we have handlers let them know we're beginning.
00155   for(unsigned int i = 0; i < m_Handle.size(); i++) {
00156     ProgressHandler *handle = m_Handle[i];
00157     if(handle->handleAll()) 
00158       handle->progressBegin(verbosity, msg, maxCalls);
00159     else
00160       handle->progressBegin(verbosity, msg, total);
00161   }
00162 }
00163 
00164 
00165 void Verbose::progressEnd(int verbosity, const std::string &msg) {
00166   Verbose::Param &p = getParam();
00167 
00168   assert(p.m_DotCount.size() > 0);
00169   assert(p.m_DotMod.size() > 0);
00170 
00171   p.m_DotMod.pop_back();
00172   p.m_DotCount.pop_back();
00173   if(verbosity <= p.m_Verbosity) {
00174     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < p.m_ProHandler.size(); i++) {
00175       p.m_ProHandler[i]->progressEnd(verbosity, msg);
00176     }
00177   }
00178 }
00179 
00180 void Verbose::removeMsgHandler(MsgHandler *h) {
00181   Verbose::Param &p = getParam();
00182   removeMsgHandler(p.m_MsgHandler, h);
00183   removeMsgHandler(p.m_WarnHandler, h);
00184 }
00185 
00186 void Verbose::removeProgressHandler(ProgressHandler *h) {
00187   Verbose::Param &p = getParam();
00188   removeProgressHandler(p.m_ProHandler, h);
00189 }
00190 
00191 void Verbose::removeMsgHandler(std::vector<MsgHandler *> &vec, MsgHandler *h) {
00192   vector<MsgHandler *>::iterator i;
00193   for (i = vec.begin(); i < vec.end(); i++) {
00194     if (*i == h) {
00195       vec.erase(i);
00196       break;
00197     }
00198   }
00199 } 
00200 
00201 void Verbose::removeProgressHandler(std::vector<ProgressHandler *> &vec, ProgressHandler *h) {
00202   vector<ProgressHandler *>::iterator i;
00203   for (i = vec.begin(); i < vec.end(); i++) {
00204     if (*i == h) {
00205       vec.erase(i);
00206       break;
00207     }
00208   }
00209 } 
00210 
00211 void Verbose::removeDefault() {
00212   Verbose::Param &p = getParam();
00213   if (!p.m_ProHandler.empty() && p.m_ProHandler[0] == p.m_ProgDefault) {
00214     p.m_ProHandler.erase(p.m_ProHandler.begin());
00215     p.m_ProgDefault = NULL;
00216   }
00217   if (!p.m_MsgHandler.empty() && p.m_MsgHandler[0] == p.m_MsgDefault) {
00218     p.m_MsgHandler.erase(p.m_MsgHandler.begin());
00219     p.m_MsgDefault = NULL;
00220   }
00221   if (!p.m_WarnHandler.empty() && p.m_WarnHandler[0] == p.m_WarnDefault) {
00222     p.m_WarnHandler.erase(p.m_WarnHandler.begin());
00223   }
00224 }

00226 /** 
00227  * @brief Set whether or not output messages are logged
00228  *        useful to turn off output when catching expected errors
00229  *
00230  * @param output - true or false
00231  */  
00232 void Verbose::setOutput(bool output) {
00233   Verbose::Param &p = getParam();
00234   p.m_Output = output;
00235 }
00236 
00237 /** 
00238  * @brief Set the level of verbosity desired. 0 == no messages
00239  * 1 == normal messages, 2,3,4, etc. == more verbose.
00240  * @param level - level of verbosity desired.
00241  */  
00242 void Verbose::setLevel(int level) {
00243   Verbose::Param &p = getParam();
00244   p.m_Verbosity = level;
00245   for(unsigned int i = 0; i < p.m_ProHandler.size(); i++) {
00246     p.m_ProHandler[i]->setBaseVerbosity(level);
00247   }
00248   for(unsigned int i = 0; i < p.m_MsgHandler.size(); i++) {
00249     p.m_MsgHandler[i]->setBaseVerbosity(level);
00250   }
00251 }
00252 
00253 /** 
00254  * @brief Print a message to the stream.
00255  * @param level - What level of verbosity this message should be printed at.
00256  * @param s - Message to be printed.
00257  * @param nl - Should a newline be appended to message?
00258  */
00259 void Verbose::out(int level, const std::string &s, bool nl) { 
00260   Verbose::Param &p = getParam();
00261   if(p.m_Output) {
00262       for(unsigned int i = 0; i < p.m_MsgHandler.size(); i++) {
00263           p.m_MsgHandler[i]->message(level, s, nl);
00264       }
00265   }
00266   // this forces our messages out to the OS, so we know what is going on.
00267   // If someone (errabort) calls exit, the messages might be left in our buffers and not written out.  
00268   fflush(NULL); 
00269 }
00270 
00271 /** 
00272  * @brief Print a warning message.
00273  * @param level - What level of verbosity this message should be printed at.
00274  * @param s - Message to be printed.
00275  * @param nl - Should a newline be appended to message?
00276  */
00277 void Verbose::warn(int level, const std::string &s, bool nl, const std::string prefix) {
00278   Verbose::Param &p = getParam();
00279   if(p.m_Output) {
00280       for(unsigned int i = 0; i < p.m_WarnHandler.size(); i++) {
00281           p.m_WarnHandler[i]->message(level, prefix + s, nl);
00282       }
00283   }
00284 }
